intro: Paepalanthus androsaceus, commonly known as the Andean snowbell, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Andes Mountains. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its compact, low-growing habit. The plant produces small, bell-shaped white or pink flowers that bloom in the spring. Its foliage consists of dense, woolly leaves that help it withstand cold and harsh environmental conditions. Paepalanthus androsaceus is often found in rocky or alpine habitats, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
